7// Framebuffer.h: Defines the gl::Framebuffer class. Implements GL framebuffer
8// objects and related functionality. [OpenGL ES 2.0.24] section 4.4 page 105.
9
10#ifndef LIBANGLE_FRAMEBUFFER_H_
11#define LIBANGLE_FRAMEBUFFER_H_
12

40namespace gl
41{
42struct Caps;
43class Context;
44struct Extensions;
45class Framebuffer;
46class ImageIndex;
47struct Rectangle;
48class Renderbuffer;
49class State;
50class Texture;
51class TextureCapsMap;
52
53class FramebufferState final : angle::NonCopyable
54{
55 public:
56 explicit FramebufferState(rx::Serial serial);
57 FramebufferState(const Caps &caps, FramebufferID id, rx::Serial serial);
58 ~FramebufferState();
59
60 const std::string &getLabel() const;
61 uint32_t getReadIndex() const;
62
63 const FramebufferAttachment *getAttachment(const Context *context, GLenum attachment) const;
64 const FramebufferAttachment *getReadAttachment() const;
65 const FramebufferAttachment *getFirstNonNullAttachment() const;
66 const FramebufferAttachment *getFirstColorAttachment() const;
67 const FramebufferAttachment *getDepthOrStencilAttachment() const;
68 const FramebufferAttachment *getStencilOrDepthStencilAttachment() const;
69 const FramebufferAttachment *getColorAttachment(size_t colorAttachment) const;
70 const FramebufferAttachment *getDepthAttachment() const;
71 const FramebufferAttachment *getStencilAttachment() const;
72 const FramebufferAttachment *getDepthStencilAttachment() const;
73 const FramebufferAttachment *getReadPixelsAttachment(GLenum readFormat) const;
74
75 const std::vector<GLenum> &getDrawBufferStates() const { return mDrawBufferStates; }
76 DrawBufferMask getEnabledDrawBuffers() const { return mEnabledDrawBuffers; }
77 GLenum getReadBufferState() const { return mReadBufferState; }
78 const std::vector<FramebufferAttachment> &getColorAttachments() const
79 {
80 return mColorAttachments;
81 }
82 const DrawBufferMask getColorAttachmentsMask() const { return mColorAttachmentsMask; }
83
84 bool attachmentsHaveSameDimensions() const;
85 bool hasSeparateDepthAndStencilAttachments() const;
86 bool colorAttachmentsAreUniqueImages() const;
87 Box getDimensions() const;
88 Extents getExtents() const;
89
90 const FramebufferAttachment *getDrawBuffer(size_t drawBufferIdx) const;
91 size_t getDrawBufferCount() const;
92
93 GLint getDefaultWidth() const { return mDefaultWidth; }
94 GLint getDefaultHeight() const { return mDefaultHeight; }
95 GLint getDefaultSamples() const { return mDefaultSamples; }
96 bool getDefaultFixedSampleLocations() const { return mDefaultFixedSampleLocations; }
97 GLint getDefaultLayers() const { return mDefaultLayers; }
98
99 bool hasDepth() const;
100 bool hasStencil() const;
101
102 bool isMultiview() const;
103
104 ANGLE_INLINE GLsizei getNumViews() const
105 {
106 const FramebufferAttachment *attachment = getFirstNonNullAttachment();
107 if (attachment == nullptr)
108 {
109 return FramebufferAttachment::kDefaultNumViews;
110 }
111 return attachment->getNumViews();
112 }
113
114 GLint getBaseViewIndex() const;
115
116 FramebufferID id() const { return mId; }
117
118 bool isDefault() const;
119
120 const gl::Offset &getSurfaceTextureOffset() const { return mSurfaceTextureOffset; }
121
122 rx::Serial getFramebufferSerial() const { return mFramebufferSerial; }
123
124 private:
125 const FramebufferAttachment *getWebGLDepthStencilAttachment() const;
126 const FramebufferAttachment *getWebGLDepthAttachment() const;
127 const FramebufferAttachment *getWebGLStencilAttachment() const;
128
129 friend class Framebuffer;
130
131 // The Framebuffer ID is unique to a Context.
132 // The Framebuffer Serial is unique to a Share Group.
133 FramebufferID mId;
134 rx::Serial mFramebufferSerial;
135 std::string mLabel;
136
137 std::vector<FramebufferAttachment> mColorAttachments;
138 FramebufferAttachment mDepthAttachment;
139 FramebufferAttachment mStencilAttachment;
140
141 // Tracks all the color buffers attached to this FramebufferDesc
142 gl::DrawBufferMask mColorAttachmentsMask;
143
144 std::vector<GLenum> mDrawBufferStates;
145 GLenum mReadBufferState;
146 DrawBufferMask mEnabledDrawBuffers;
147 ComponentTypeMask mDrawBufferTypeMask;
148
149 GLint mDefaultWidth;
150 GLint mDefaultHeight;
151 GLint mDefaultSamples;
152 bool mDefaultFixedSampleLocations;
153 GLint mDefaultLayers;
154
155 // It's necessary to store all this extra state so we can restore attachments
156 // when DEPTH_STENCIL/DEPTH/STENCIL is unbound in WebGL 1.
157 FramebufferAttachment mWebGLDepthStencilAttachment;
158 FramebufferAttachment mWebGLDepthAttachment;
159 FramebufferAttachment mWebGLStencilAttachment;
160 bool mWebGLDepthStencilConsistent;
161
162 // Tracks if we need to initialize the resources for each attachment.
163 angle::BitSet<IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENTS + 2> mResourceNeedsInit;
164
165 bool mDefaultFramebufferReadAttachmentInitialized;
166 FramebufferAttachment mDefaultFramebufferReadAttachment;
167
168 gl::Offset mSurfaceTextureOffset;
169};
170
171class Framebuffer final : public angle::ObserverInterface,
172 public LabeledObject,
173 public angle::Subject
174{
175 public:
176 // Constructor to build application-defined framebuffers
177 Framebuffer(const Caps &caps,
178 rx::GLImplFactory *factory,
179 FramebufferID id,
180 egl::ShareGroup *shareGroup);
181 // Constructor to build default framebuffers for a surface and context pair
182 Framebuffer(const Context *context, egl::Surface *surface, egl::Surface *readSurface);
183 // Constructor to build a fake default framebuffer when surfaceless
184 Framebuffer(const Context *context, rx::GLImplFactory *factory, egl::Surface *readSurface);
185
186 ~Framebuffer() override;
187 void onDestroy(const Context *context);
188
189 void setReadSurface(const Context *context, egl::Surface *readSurface);
190 void setLabel(const Context *context, const std::string &label) override;
191 const std::string &getLabel() const override;
192
193 rx::FramebufferImpl *getImplementation() const { return mImpl; }
194
195 FramebufferID id() const { return mState.mId; }
196
197 void setAttachment(const Context *context,
198 GLenum type,
199 GLenum binding,
200 const ImageIndex &textureIndex,
201 FramebufferAttachmentObject *resource);
202 void setAttachmentMultisample(const Context *context,
203 GLenum type,
204 GLenum binding,
205 const ImageIndex &textureIndex,
206 FramebufferAttachmentObject *resource,
207 GLsizei samples);
208 void setAttachmentMultiview(const Context *context,
209 GLenum type,
210 GLenum binding,
211 const ImageIndex &textureIndex,
212 FramebufferAttachmentObject *resource,
213 GLsizei numViews,
214 GLint baseViewIndex);
215 void resetAttachment(const Context *context, GLenum binding);
216
217 bool detachTexture(const Context *context, TextureID texture);
218 bool detachRenderbuffer(const Context *context, RenderbufferID renderbuffer);
219
220 const FramebufferAttachment *getColorAttachment(size_t colorAttachment) const;
221 const FramebufferAttachment *getDepthAttachment() const;
222 const FramebufferAttachment *getStencilAttachment() const;
223 const FramebufferAttachment *getDepthStencilAttachment() const;
224 const FramebufferAttachment *getDepthOrStencilAttachment() const;
225 const FramebufferAttachment *getStencilOrDepthStencilAttachment() const;
226 const FramebufferAttachment *getReadColorAttachment() const;
227 GLenum getReadColorAttachmentType() const;
228 const FramebufferAttachment *getFirstColorAttachment() const;
229 const FramebufferAttachment *getFirstNonNullAttachment() const;
230
231 const std::vector<FramebufferAttachment> &getColorAttachments() const
232 {
233 return mState.mColorAttachments;
234 }
235
236 const FramebufferState &getState() const { return mState; }
237
238 const FramebufferAttachment *getAttachment(const Context *context, GLenum attachment) const;
239 bool isMultiview() const;
240 bool readDisallowedByMultiview() const;
241 GLsizei getNumViews() const;
242 GLint getBaseViewIndex() const;
243 Extents getExtents() const;
244
245 size_t getDrawbufferStateCount() const;
246 GLenum getDrawBufferState(size_t drawBuffer) const;
247 const std::vector<GLenum> &getDrawBufferStates() const;
248 void setDrawBuffers(size_t count, const GLenum *buffers);
249 const FramebufferAttachment *getDrawBuffer(size_t drawBuffer) const;
250 ComponentType getDrawbufferWriteType(size_t drawBuffer) const;
251 ComponentTypeMask getDrawBufferTypeMask() const;
252 DrawBufferMask getDrawBufferMask() const;
253 bool hasEnabledDrawBuffer() const;
254
255 GLenum getReadBufferState() const;
256 void setReadBuffer(GLenum buffer);
257
258 size_t getNumColorAttachments() const;
259 bool hasDepth() const;
260 bool hasStencil() const;
261
262 bool usingExtendedDrawBuffers() const;
263
264 // This method calls checkStatus.
265 int getSamples(const Context *context) const;
266 int getReadBufferResourceSamples(const Context *context) const;
267
268 angle::Result getSamplePosition(const Context *context, size_t index, GLfloat *xy) const;
269
270 GLint getDefaultWidth() const;
271 GLint getDefaultHeight() const;
272 GLint getDefaultSamples() const;
273 bool getDefaultFixedSampleLocations() const;
274 GLint getDefaultLayers() const;
275 void setDefaultWidth(const Context *context, GLint defaultWidth);
276 void setDefaultHeight(const Context *context, GLint defaultHeight);
277 void setDefaultSamples(const Context *context, GLint defaultSamples);
278 void setDefaultFixedSampleLocations(const Context *context, bool defaultFixedSampleLocations);
279 void setDefaultLayers(GLint defaultLayers);
280
281 void invalidateCompletenessCache();
282 ANGLE_INLINE bool cachedStatusValid() { return mCachedStatus.valid(); }
283
284 ANGLE_INLINE GLenum checkStatus(const Context *context) const
285 {
286 // The default framebuffer is always complete except when it is surfaceless in which
287 // case it is always unsupported.
288 ASSERT(!isDefault() || mCachedStatus.valid());
289 if (isDefault() || (!hasAnyDirtyBit() && mCachedStatus.valid()))
290 {
291 return mCachedStatus.value();
292 }
293
294 return checkStatusImpl(context);
295 }
296
297 // Helper for checkStatus == GL_FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE.
298 ANGLE_INLINE bool isComplete(const Context *context) const
299 {
300 return (checkStatus(context) == GL_FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE);
301 }
302
303 bool hasValidDepthStencil() const;
304
305 // Returns the offset into the texture backing the default framebuffer's surface if any. Returns
306 // zero offset otherwise. The renderer will apply the offset to scissor and viewport rects used
307 // for draws, clears, and blits.
308 const gl::Offset &getSurfaceTextureOffset() const;
309
310 angle::Result discard(const Context *context, size_t count, const GLenum *attachments);
311 angle::Result invalidate(const Context *context, size_t count, const GLenum *attachments);
312 angle::Result invalidateSub(const Context *context,
313 size_t count,
314 const GLenum *attachments,
315 const Rectangle &area);
316
317 angle::Result clear(const Context *context, GLbitfield mask);
318 angle::Result clearBufferfv(const Context *context,
319 GLenum buffer,
320 GLint drawbuffer,
321 const GLfloat *values);
322 angle::Result clearBufferuiv(const Context *context,
323 GLenum buffer,
324 GLint drawbuffer,
325 const GLuint *values);
326 angle::Result clearBufferiv(const Context *context,
327 GLenum buffer,
328 GLint drawbuffer,
329 const GLint *values);
330 angle::Result clearBufferfi(const Context *context,
331 GLenum buffer,
332 GLint drawbuffer,
333 GLfloat depth,
334 GLint stencil);
335
336 GLenum getImplementationColorReadFormat(const Context *context);
337 GLenum getImplementationColorReadType(const Context *context);
338
339 angle::Result readPixels(const Context *context,
340 const Rectangle &area,
341 GLenum format,
342 GLenum type,
343 const PixelPackState &pack,
344 Buffer *packBuffer,
345 void *pixels);
346
347 angle::Result blit(const Context *context,
348 const Rectangle &sourceArea,
349 const Rectangle &destArea,
350 GLbitfield mask,
351 GLenum filter);
352 bool isDefault() const { return mState.isDefault(); }
353
354 enum DirtyBitType : size_t
355 {
356 DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_0,
357 DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_MAX =
358 DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_0 + IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_DRAW_BUFFERS,
359 DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT = DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_MAX,
360 DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT,
361 DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_BUFFER_CONTENTS_0,
362 DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_BUFFER_CONTENTS_MAX =
363 DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_BUFFER_CONTENTS_0 + IMPLEMENTATION_MAX_DRAW_BUFFERS,
364 DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_BUFFER_CONTENTS = DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_BUFFER_CONTENTS_MAX,
365 DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_BUFFER_CONTENTS,
366 DIRTY_BIT_DRAW_BUFFERS,
367 DIRTY_BIT_READ_BUFFER,
368 DIRTY_BIT_DEFAULT_WIDTH,
369 DIRTY_BIT_DEFAULT_HEIGHT,
370 DIRTY_BIT_DEFAULT_SAMPLES,
371 DIRTY_BIT_DEFAULT_FIXED_SAMPLE_LOCATIONS,
372 DIRTY_BIT_DEFAULT_LAYERS,
373 DIRTY_BIT_UNKNOWN,
374 DIRTY_BIT_MAX = DIRTY_BIT_UNKNOWN
375 };
376
377 using DirtyBits = angle::BitSet<DIRTY_BIT_MAX>;
378 bool hasAnyDirtyBit() const { return mDirtyBits.any(); }
379
380 DrawBufferMask getActiveFloat32ColorAttachmentDrawBufferMask() const
381 {
382 return mFloat32ColorAttachmentBits & getDrawBufferMask();
383 }
384
385 bool hasResourceThatNeedsInit() const { return mState.mResourceNeedsInit.any(); }
386
387 angle::Result syncState(const Context *context,
388 GLenum framebufferBinding,
389 Command command) const;
390
391 // Observer implementation
392 void onSubjectStateChange(angle::SubjectIndex index, angle::SubjectMessage message) override;
393
394 bool formsRenderingFeedbackLoopWith(const Context *context) const;
395 bool formsCopyingFeedbackLoopWith(TextureID copyTextureID,
396 GLint copyTextureLevel,
397 GLint copyTextureLayer) const;
398
399 angle::Result ensureClearAttachmentsInitialized(const Context *context, GLbitfield mask);
400 angle::Result ensureClearBufferAttachmentsInitialized(const Context *context,
401 GLenum buffer,
402 GLint drawbuffer);
403 angle::Result ensureDrawAttachmentsInitialized(const Context *context);
404
405 // Conservatively initializes both read color and depth. Blit can access the depth buffer.
406 angle::Result ensureReadAttachmentsInitialized(const Context *context);
407 Box getDimensions() const;
408
409 static const FramebufferID kDefaultDrawFramebufferHandle;
410
411 private:
412 bool detachResourceById(const Context *context, GLenum resourceType, GLuint resourceId);
413 bool detachMatchingAttachment(const Context *context,
414 FramebufferAttachment *attachment,
415 GLenum matchType,
416 GLuint matchId);
417 GLenum checkStatusWithGLFrontEnd(const Context *context) const;
418 GLenum checkStatusImpl(const Context *context) const;
419 void setAttachment(const Context *context,
420 GLenum type,
421 GLenum binding,
422 const ImageIndex &textureIndex,
423 FramebufferAttachmentObject *resource,
424 GLsizei numViews,
425 GLuint baseViewIndex,
426 bool isMultiview,
427 GLsizei samples);
428 void commitWebGL1DepthStencilIfConsistent(const Context *context,
429 GLsizei numViews,
430 GLuint baseViewIndex,
431 bool isMultiview,
432 GLsizei samples);
433 void setAttachmentImpl(const Context *context,
434 GLenum type,
435 GLenum binding,
436 const ImageIndex &textureIndex,
437 FramebufferAttachmentObject *resource,
438 GLsizei numViews,
439 GLuint baseViewIndex,
440 bool isMultiview,
441 GLsizei samples);
442 void updateAttachment(const Context *context,
443 FramebufferAttachment *attachment,
444 size_t dirtyBit,
445 angle::ObserverBinding *onDirtyBinding,
446 GLenum type,
447 GLenum binding,
448 const ImageIndex &textureIndex,
449 FramebufferAttachmentObject *resource,
450 GLsizei numViews,
451 GLuint baseViewIndex,
452 bool isMultiview,
453 GLsizei samples);
454
455 void markDrawAttachmentsInitialized(bool color, bool depth, bool stencil);
456 void markBufferInitialized(GLenum bufferType, GLint bufferIndex);
457 angle::Result ensureBufferInitialized(const Context *context,
458 GLenum bufferType,
459 GLint bufferIndex);
460
461 // Checks that we have a partially masked clear:
462 // * some color channels are masked out
463 // * some stencil values are masked out
464 // * scissor test partially overlaps the framebuffer
465 bool partialClearNeedsInit(const Context *context, bool color, bool depth, bool stencil);
466 bool partialBufferClearNeedsInit(const Context *context, GLenum bufferType);
467
468 FramebufferAttachment *getAttachmentFromSubjectIndex(angle::SubjectIndex index);
469
470 ANGLE_INLINE void updateFloat32ColorAttachmentBits(size_t index,
471 const gl::InternalFormat *format)
472 {
473 mFloat32ColorAttachmentBits.set(index, format->type == GL_FLOAT);
474 }
475
476 FramebufferState mState;
477 rx::FramebufferImpl *mImpl;
478
479 mutable Optional<GLenum> mCachedStatus;
480 std::vector<angle::ObserverBinding> mDirtyColorAttachmentBindings;
481 angle::ObserverBinding mDirtyDepthAttachmentBinding;
482 angle::ObserverBinding mDirtyStencilAttachmentBinding;
483
484 mutable DirtyBits mDirtyBits;
485 DrawBufferMask mFloat32ColorAttachmentBits;
486
487 // The dirty bits guard is checked when we get a dependent state change message. We verify that
488 // we don't set a dirty bit that isn't already set, when inside the dirty bits syncState.
489 mutable Optional<DirtyBits> mDirtyBitsGuard;
490};
491
492} // namespace gl

494#endif // LIBANGLE_FRAMEBUFFER_H_
